title: Fourth Grade
subject: Outcomes for Intellectually Gifted Education Programs (2017-)

document.title: OUTCOMES for Intellectually Gifted Education Programs 2017

F6FB896F50E54C5580C007AEA7BDB0BC.description:
Create scripts (commercials, plays, etc.) to communicate
ideas and feelings

D62622884DFB4D3D8DE2E69FC942E477.description:
Analyze the writing style of scripts (commercials,
plays, etc.)

154898C18F0B4FE09098635D93A234B0.description:
Listen to oral directions for understanding and organize
directions for complex tasks

E1BF0A04FEE14D29B645074E86152490.description:
Identify the purpose, content, organization, and delivery
of oral communication and evaluate based upon preset
criteria developed by teacher and class

CFD28D2732F640DC8784D9CD5BF70511.description:
Demonstrate effective listening behaviors in formal and
informal settings

162113B611074721AEE9A2C2B9F83713.description:
Participate in a variety of formal/ informal speaking
activities and self-evaluate utilizing preset criteria

AFA25DCFE8BF47AA802D4A1A3A697580.description: Give precise instructions for complex tasks and selfevaluate utilizing preset criteria

36FFFE63049A4467A4A998526EBF3214.description:
Communicate complete thoughts and information with
clarity to an appropriate audience

898EE388CED944CA9CA4F79AACF090BD.description:
Given the need to retrieve and/or disseminate information, the students will select and
utilize the most appropriate media based upon available resources, technology, audience,
and time available, for the most effective communication of information, ideas, feelings,
and concepts and correctly interpreting those of others.

0E69AC3173FA4C8EA3065B6B485FDCEF.description: Demonstrate respect and empathy for others

1EEE6CEFBBA84F53B4066B31A9032677.description:
Show evidence of delayed gratification and
impulse control

460278759E4B4C1597E06D71B969D045.description:
Identify sources and possible solutions of stress
and anxiety

B3BA065808D743E08AFEE7F01C3CAD51.description:
Demonstrate an understanding and assess the social,
emotional and academic implications of giftedness

6E7E9E5F20EC447D8DBEC7CC0427ACFB.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of and reflect upon
personal gifted characteristics

913343D96E70429F9D09F7AA77A35E53.description:
As a gifted learner, students will develop self-acceptance and awareness and
demonstrate responsibility for personal growth along with awareness of personal and
cultural diversity in others by recognizing forms of bias and stereotypes in order to
respect unique beliefs and experiences in themselves and others by understanding and
embracing giftedness, appropriately coping with stress in order to become healthy,
responsive, contributing, and productive members of classroom communities and
society as a whole.

C7F6E022EC7C433183D128A93B923D95.description:
As a group member, work collaboratively to achieve
a common goal

C8C2B616197141E3998EC4B871C10E28.description:
As a group leader, effectively work with group
members to establish goals and objectives for
successful collaboration

0D71FFC6513D4B869574888BAED21316.description:
Demonstrate the ability to establish budgets and
manage money in a variety of situations

8C83E0B6B7074AF7BCB0649D3CE2B964.description:
Identify career options through experiences
and interviews with experts in the field and
career counselors

2769B87893AD49578F1B98B6665DDD39.description:
Individually identify personal problems, utilize
visualization to weigh the possibilities, make
judgements, and defend decisions

2A9EAC1D5FB24A7BA49F8614261ACCE3.description:
DECISION MAKING
AND PROBLEM
SOLVING SKILLS

3E187152CC8A4547975A163142D1A10D.description:
Given a real-life situation, the student will utilize effective organizational, decision
making, goal-setting, project management, and time management skills, including
controlling impulses and adapting to unforeseen circumstances, in order to develop
solutions to problems and achieve goals whether working individually or as a leader or
member of a team.

D4EC56E8BAE74B8EBFD866E128A061D9.description:
Justify conclusions and generalizations based
upon data gathered through research

2EB828E0DAD14131BA29C6BD6DDEA95D.description:
Create and visually organize information using
charts, tables, graphs, evidence, or patterns

C048A1C30A954FF689149F8AAC0EEFD4.description:
Assemble information by utilizing effective
survey techniques

EFAD1C8244C040119E389F196DBC83F3.description:
Conduct experiments and investigations by
effectively utilizing the Scientific Method

6D22FCEE62B646EF961F3BC88DD65B96.description:
Given a real-life situation, the student will identify and define the problem, design a
research plan appropriate to the problem, conduct the investigation, decide on the most
appropriate media for dissemination of the findings/ solutions, and present the results
before an authentic audience.

695D2E2D505D4A2BB5E987E4F96319B9.description:
Analyze and utilize principles of design (contrast,
repetition, alignment, proximity) to create
various products based on subject matter or
personal interest

41E28FCFC9F743BCA9CD95C67DA90721.description:
Interpret art by analyzing the mood suggested
by a work of art and describing relevant
subject matter

F9A28DA0FB7E4D2F8BF757B2E3EBD012.description:
Evaluate alternative solutions using the
criteria

BDA0DB4B77D8463DBEF6EDAEA33B6FDC.description:
Demonstrate the ability to follow the Creative
Problem Solving (CPS) process to solve a given
problem

F87350DE52CA4C99ABB5DC7DA2EA9454.description:
Apply imagination by visualizing ideas, the
process to be followed, possible outcomes, and
consequences of ideas, thoughts, or plans to solve
a given problem

95486AFEC87B45968A401E2D09706F54.description:
Apply complexity of thought to organize logical
steps needed to solve a given problem

2068DA89DF234A69BA1D47A8000D3C40.description:
Apply risk-taking by making predictions and
experimenting in an unstructured setting to solve a
given problem

3991042B8E764C99B68BA1EFD29BECED.description:
Apply curiosity in compiling questions to be
answered to solve a given problem

CFAAA47881EF4E7DB4AB1AEF19E87481.description:
CREATIVE THINKING
Williams Model: Affective Domain

39F4AF65A1D1466CA0E801F72E5698B8.description:
Elaborate on identified ideas, thoughts, products
or plans to solve a given problem

B39329597E454C748B2F70C2E59C80C1.description:
Apply originality in generating original ideas or
alternative solutions to given problems

8036D6649D3A481A8CD09D5E19C8B002.description:
Apply flexibility by adapting generated ideas,
thoughts, products, or plans for many different
creative uses to solve a given problem

A0743C8C6E7D462DA451B21889D99DA0.description:
Apply fluency by brainstorming to generate a large
quantity of ideas, thoughts, products, or plans to
solve a given problem

AF97CA7F35544DA0A68FAB7A7796A6B4.description:
CREATIVE THINKING
Williams Model: Cognitive Domain

98A990FCDC9445A387D89B2A02FBB3BA.description:
Given a real-life situation, the student will be able to select from divergent thinking,
analogical thinking, visualization, attribute listing, morphological analysis, synectics,
intuitive thinking, spontaneous thinking, creative problem solving, and/or the creative
process in an appropriate manner to develop a workable solution(s).

58616D25190749C3B1B100A5D8ABEFD5.description:
Appraise implications and consequences of personal actions
and decisions

79EFB3F5A0194B2DADF689F30E1CEB91.description:
Assess the organization, content, value, effectiveness, and
results of actions/decisions.

D744B3C7BD7248A698F9CB95D4EF6F67.description:
Discuss and analyze events and issues for problem
identification

4C083FC943114EC981760C23F2ACB98C.description:
Utilize intuitive thinking to deepen understanding and
analyze varying perspectives

097FC2C59E4B41099D4F9F5B11458B29.description:
Apply deductive reasoning of general to specific information
to analyze and organize multi-faceted clues and identify data
to support logical conclusions

7087E6397F574652861FDDFFF60B5BF5.description:
Utilize analogical reasoning to create analogies using
multiple categories

2EC6E7EB108C4CAFB5BD9E24B10616FB.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of analogical reasoning by
identifying, explaining, and giving examples of the forms
of analogies

64BB310C783C433F84917F2AD2B062A8.description:
Analyze, reflect upon, and justify learning experiences,
identifying what was learned, tasks completed, skills
developed, additional needs, and value of the experiences

ECD62681E2DF42AD98BBE44CF45C42C4.description: Develop hypothetical questions to explore possibilities

5A780BCEEB3944BAB0ED3B04A4976064.description: Observe, analyze, and apply abstract thinking skills

8B2EBB18E5944C8D89FEDAF8E42D3D1A.description:
Given a topic/situation, the learner will define and classify the problem(s), make
connections, and draw distinctions, analyze information objectively and critically
(reflectively developing a relationship between facts and values), and differentiate truth
and beliefs from his/her understanding of what is logically and realistically possible.
